page.title: 13Social Activities
page.content: Hatfield Peverel is not a particularly pretty village but it is a busy village with a friendly atmosphere. There is a Village Hall where many activities take place, it was built between 1980 and 1982. Villagers were asked if they could help in anyway to complete the hall. The roof, lighting, painting and decorating were all done by the villagers. Also many fund raising activities were organised in the village, such as 'Brick Bond Raffles' to help meet the cost. In September 1982 the Village Hall was opened by Admiral Sir Andrew Lewis. The Village Hall contains a large hall, and a stage, a small meeting room, a bar and snooker room and toilets. Plans for extending the Village Hall are at present in progress. The Village Hall is very well used by all ages.
